reviews.review_msg: He's very funny and entertaining.  Lecture recordings and notes are all posted online so attending lectures are optional.  Lecture exams are fair and straight-forward; you just have to memorize the lecture notes.  Labs are fun and easy.  Lab exams were easy but the anatomy exam was confusing (only worth 10% though.)  Overall, a great class.
Don't even need to go to class. Lectures are all online. Exam is straight out of lecture notes. TA's are the best for this course. Clear expectations of students.

He connects the lectures to real life. He lectures in an interesting story-telling style. Makes jokes and includes funny pictures in lecture slides. Very helpful when you go to his office hours for help or remarking. He often shows us interesting articles and he got a section for them on Canvas.

Craig was a great professor. Lectures were interesting and he was definitely energetic about his field. The lab test questions were provided in the lab manual so there were no surprises. He was also constantly available and was flexible with his hours. If I could take the course again, I would.

Hard class but prof is quite good, very interested in what he's teaching. All lecs are recorded and it's all memorization with some anatomy and other things. There's a lab with a quiz every week. There are also lab assignments every week so overall its a hard but interesting course. No textbook but lab book needed.
The key to this class is to memorize everything and do all the study questions!

Super good prof!! He's constantly straightforward, lays down everything you need to know! All the topics he tests on exams come from his lecture notes and nothing else, so you have no reason to panic except memorize, memorize, memorize. He also makes lectures enjoyable and ensures people know what they're learning! You MUST put in the effort.
Great prof! Best class ive taken so far. To get a good mark you have to put the work in... He is straight-up and tests are extreamly FAIR. 10/10

Great professor, he has a great interest in what he is teaching which in turn rubs off on students. His lectures are engaging he adds adventure stories about his life which gives the topics a real life perspective. The exams were straightforward, I would recommend knowing everything thing on the lecture noted especially things you can list.

Very hard course, because you gotta study you a__ off if you want to pass. I did just that and escaped with a "B". However, you do learn a lot, and I recommend it to hard working students. I don't recommend it as a credit course.
GREAT professor! oneof the best ever, super helpful andinteresting, really knows his stuff, with fair (but hard) tests
Good Prof. Learned loads. Tests are very fair, not bad. Study a lot for the lab midterm and final though

Good prof.Knows his stuff.One piece of advice that will get you the good grade is, DO YOUR LAB QUESTIONS as you do your labs instead of at the end because they are on the exam and they are time consuming b/c the answers are not all in the notes and text book! Keep up with the lecture notes or just memorize them inside out!

Please avoid the Dist Ed version of this course if you can....  what a nightmare.  I believe about 30% of the students in KIN 142 DE failed the class.  The grade was much lower than I expected.  I should have taken a different DE Sci elective instead.

He is as crystal clear as they come - his exams are extremely fair.  Do the questions.. they will be on the exams.  The lab is wicked.. super laid back and you learn a lot.  The most fair proff i've ever had!
Great course. Asmundson is enthusiastic about what he teaches and is clear in delivering his message.
Don't take this course unless you're prepared to study your brains out! Its like biology AP multiplied by 3! Alot of work...

Pretty easy class.  If you're a kin major and have a good memory you can probably get away with studyign 3 days before and get an A.  Everything you need to know is in online notes, although I recommend doing/getting off someone the study questions.

Good prof, you can tell he loves what he does. His notes were great to have. Lecture material is pretty straight froward and his stories make class interesting. However, I found exams difficult, especially the lab material. Labs were ok, would've been better with a more helpful TA.

his anecdotes kept you awake and his notes are super clear and easy to understand. the tests are staightforward and right out of his notes. REALLY interesting class, though labs are a little tedious. awesome prof!!
good prof; very interested in the subject matter.  exams though have lots of memorizing to do

Really good prof. Dedicated and always willing to answer your questions.  The course isn't easy = just keep on top of the material and u should be fine.  IT takes effort, but its worth it - labs are fun.
This course was sooo good topped off by an even better prof. His passion for kin reflects in everything he does and it will make you like kin too.
No Comments

Tests come from the notes he gives which are more than enough. DO NOT BUY THE TEXT it is useless as the lab manual and lecture notes are very good. I really enjoyed his lectures. His stories are usually pretty funny. If you are taking this course, the stories and pictures usually help to keep you from becoming bored.

For the distance version of the course, stay away, way too much work and little help not to mention the text is horrible.  Note that they are reworking the class to be different for next Fall.  As it stands its horrible.

his passion for kinesiology and sense of humor makes the class great. u really dont need the textbook; his notes are enough. and i actually like his stories and pictures..makes the class interesting:)
No Comments
I thought his notes were well done. Don't buy the text book, you dont need it. His lectures were okay. I wouldnt mind having him again for another class.
I always fall asleep during his lectures since they are so boring! Labs are not bad.

Simple course and easygoing prof... nothing gets easier than studying for his tests because everything he will ever ask is in his online notes so it's not a guessing game like some other classes.  Lectures are not mandatory but he does have alot of interesting things to say (mostly about camping and his grandchildren though:P) Labs are harder...

text book is no long required after my semester apparently, dont attend lecture, theres no point, tests are all from notes, 3 finals - anatomy, lab, and lecture, if your not a science student DO NOT take this course, take kin 143 =D
No Comments
The course is very straightforward. THe prof is good at presenting all his materials. NOt boring at all.
Lectures were ok...just studying from his online notes. The textbook is not needed. Labs are really fun, especially with Vineet. A lot of work is needed, but it can be done. Great class!
No Comments

This class was fun, but the exams were hard! You have to memorize all the lecture notes and lab manual. Craig is funny but always brings up camping trips or his grandson in lectures..lol. Fun class, but a lot of work (ps. TA Evan is a hard marker, watch out!)

You don't have to attend lectures. He basically reads off his notes. Just memorize ALL the notes then you will be fine. The labs are fun to do, but the review questions have no answers. This class is about memorization and research.

this is a hard course with lots of material. he talks a lot about things that have only slight relevance to the topic at hand, but notes ARE online, but you'll need to memorized ALL of them for the tests...

The professor is difficult to hear because he either talks too softly, or he mumbles.  He has been teaching the course for some time now, and his enthusiasm for teaching it is waning.  The course notes are not clear unless you attend class.

Textbook? What textbook? With this prof, you didn't need one. Notes are crystal clear and extremely helpful. The course covers a lot of material, so be prepared to study your brains out, but if you like human physiology, this is for you.

Funny and interesting lectures. Very helpful in office hours, and even helps out in labs sometimes. At the end of the last lecture, everyone in the class stood up and started applauding. hah! if that doesn't mean great, nothing does.

Good lecture, boring course. If you want to get an A, you'll have to practically memorize every single term and detail from his lecture notes. Although 80% is A-, this course is NOT easy credit, don't take it unless you are prepared to study like a freak.
Boring, can't really hear him. He mumbles too much. The light is too dim, and his notes are hard to follow. Marking style differs from Bio.

This course was very difficult. The prof was okay, tended to speak very casually so it was hard to tell what material was important. The final exam is worth 55%, all handwritten, and difficult. The marking (%) balance is set up poorly. For kin.major only.
Cool prof... hilarious.... esp. w/ all his stories about his family lol.. makes his notes clearer.
very good teacher!  Helpful to go to office hours to clarify answers for 407 study questions.
He's a good professor.  Printed notes are thorough if somewhat wordy, and he tends to spend a lot of time on his vacation pictures.  Overall a good prof though.
Awesome prof. Makes courses interesting. Highly recommended if your taking 142
A great guy.  Understanding and willing to help you learn.  We need more profs like him around.
funny person, teaches well, cept the course itself is kinda dull (mostly common sense stuff)
Great prof, hilarious with his sarcasm. Makes the course material easy to understand and applies it in everyday life. Printed notes are great!
Great prof..however, talks about his prostate surgery too much
What a great guy!  Once you get used to his sarcasm, he's hilarious!!!
awesome prof! take 142 with him!
No Comments
No Comments
